intro: Kandemiria syriaca, commonly known as the Syrian kandemiria, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Turkey and the Middle East. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and prefers well-drained, rocky soils. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and it is often found in open, sunny habitats at elevations ranging from 1,500 to 3,000 meters. Kandemiria syriaca is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential medicinal properties.
